p: As shown by the microscopic imaging, the mature cypsela ( Figure 2A) was mostly occupied by a large embryo ( Figure 2Bâ€“D), which was covered by the pericarp overlain by the testa ( Figure 2E). In transverse section, the shape of the cypsela was mainly elliptical ( Figure 2B). The embryo cells (cells of both the epidermis and parenchyma) were filled with storage materials in the form of approximately globular structures ( Figure 2F).
